title: strava
text:
#install.packages('rStrava')
library('rStrava')
#devtools::install_github("fawda123/rStrava")


app <- strava_oauth(
  app_name = "Workout Predictor",
  app_client_id = "184491",
  app_secret = "705514dde6b9b41269122a7c0399cd86968528c2",
  cache = TRUE,
  app_scope = "activity:read_all"
  )

activities <- get_activity_list(app)
activities_df = compile_activities(activities)


library(dplyr)


Attaching package: 'dplyr'


The following objects are masked from 'package:stats':

    filter, lag


The following objects are masked from 'package:base':

    intersect, setdiff, setequal, union

library(ggplot2)

df <- activities_df %>%
  select(start_date_local, distance, moving_time, average_heartrate, type) %>%
  filter(activities_df$sport_type == "Run") %>% 
  mutate(
    date = as.Date(start_date_local),
    pace = (moving_time/60) / distance
  )

ggplot(df, aes(x = date, y = pace, color = type)) +
  geom_line() +
  labs(title = "Workout Pace Over Time", y = "Pace (sec/m)", x = "Date") +
  theme_minimal()









recent <- activities_df %>%
  arrange(desc(start_date_local)) %>%
  slice(1) %>%
  mutate(
    distance_miles = round(distance*1000/1609, 2),
    moving_time_min = round(moving_time / 60, 1),
    date = as.Date(start_date_local)
  ) %>% 
  select(date, distance_miles, moving_time_min, average_heartrate, type, map.summary_polyline)

title: Projects
text:
Simulated entire 2022 FIFA World Cup using a Bradley-Terry Model based on data scraped from previous 10 year match results in R. Formulated group stage and knockout round simulations with visualizations and outcomes.
View Project



Used data from 2024 MLB season to find out if pitch sequencing can have a positive effect on a pitcher‚Äôs expected runs saved.
View Project



Gathered data from over a year‚Äôs worth of workouts, including heart rate, pace, percieved exertion, and more.
View Project

title: About
text: I am currently a Junior at the University of Wisconsin-Madison studying Data Science and Economics. This is a place for me to showcase my projects I have been working on in my free time and in class.
